title: How to Make Gingerbread

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius).
steps.description: Old-fashioned gingerbread doesn’t take long to mix up, so your oven should be ready.

steps.headline: Add the sugar and softened butter into your mixer.
steps.description: Turn it on a medium setting until creamed.

steps.headline: Crack the egg and add it to your mixture.
steps.description: Mix until it is thoroughly combined.

steps.headline: Add the molasses and mix for one to two minutes.
steps.description: You can substitute one cup (237ml) of honey and four tbsp. (47g) of brown sugar for the molasses and white sugar to make a traditional Alsatian gingerbread. Melt the sugars together on the stovetop before adding.

steps.headline: Measure the flour, salt, baking soda and spices into a bowl.
steps.description: To make Alsatian gingerbread, replace the all-purpose flour with rye and whole-wheat flour in equal measure. To increase the complexity of the flavors, halve the cinnamon and add one-half tsp. (0.9g) of ground anise, one-half tsp. (1.1g) of ground nutmeg and one-half tsp. (0.9g) of ground allspice.

steps.headline: Sift them into another bowl to add air.
Add the dry ingredients slowly into the wet ingredients while mixing.
Pour one cup of hot water into the gingerbread batter.
Butter your cake pan or two loaf pans.
Pour the batter into the pan.
Place the pan in the oven and bake for 50 minutes to one hour.
steps.description: Adjust baking time for a hot or uneven oven.

steps.headline: Insert a butter knife into the center to test if it is done.
steps.description: If it comes out clean, take it out of the oven. Place the pan on a cooling rack for 20 to 30 minutes before serving.

text: Creaming Wet Ingredients Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius). Old-fashioned gingerbread doesn’t take long to mix up, so your oven should be ready. Add the sugar and softened butter into your mixer. Turn it on a medium setting until creamed. Crack the egg and add it to your mixture. Mix until it is thoroughly combined. Add the molasses and mix for one to two minutes. You can substitute one cup (237ml) of honey and four tbsp. (47g) of brown sugar for the molasses and white sugar to make a traditional Alsatian gingerbread. Melt the sugars together on the stovetop before adding. Sifting Dry Ingredients Measure the flour, salt, baking soda and spices into a bowl. To make Alsatian gingerbread, replace the all-purpose flour with rye and whole-wheat flour in equal measure. To increase the complexity of the flavors, halve the cinnamon and add one-half tsp. (0.9g) of ground anise, one-half tsp. (1.1g) of ground nutmeg and one-half tsp. (0.9g) of ground allspice. Sift them into another bowl to add air.  Add the dry ingredients slowly into the wet ingredients while mixing.  Pour one cup of hot water into the gingerbread batter. Mix until combined. Baking Gingerbread Butter your cake pan or two loaf pans.  Pour the batter into the pan.  Place the pan in the oven and bake for 50 minutes to one hour. Adjust baking time for a hot or uneven oven. Insert a butter knife into the center to test if it is done. If it comes out clean, take it out of the oven. Place the pan on a cooling rack for 20 to 30 minutes before serving.
sentences: Creaming Wet Ingredients Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (177 degrees Celsius).
Old-fashioned gingerbread doesn’t take long to mix up, so your oven should be ready.
Add the sugar and softened butter into your mixer.
Turn it on a medium setting until creamed.
Crack the egg and add it to your mixture.
Mix until it is thoroughly combined.
Add the molasses and mix for one to two minutes.
You can substitute one cup (237ml) of honey and four tbsp.
(47g) of brown sugar for the molasses and white sugar to make a traditional Alsatian gingerbread.
Melt the sugars together on the stovetop before adding.
Sifting Dry Ingredients Measure the flour, salt, baking soda and spices into a bowl.
To make Alsatian gingerbread, replace the all-purpose flour with rye and whole-wheat flour in equal measure.
To increase the complexity of the flavors, halve the cinnamon and add one-half tsp.
(0.9g) of ground anise, one-half tsp.
(1.1g) of ground nutmeg and one-half tsp.
(0.9g) of ground allspice.
Sift them into another bowl to add air.
Add the dry ingredients slowly into the wet ingredients while mixing.
Pour one cup of hot water into the gingerbread batter.
Mix until combined.
Baking Gingerbread Butter your cake pan or two loaf pans.
Pour the batter into the pan.
Place the pan in the oven and bake for 50 minutes to one hour.
Adjust baking time for a hot or uneven oven.
Insert a butter knife into the center to test if it is done.
If it comes out clean, take it out of the oven.
Place the pan on a cooling rack for 20 to 30 minutes before serving.
